summary: The National Guard counterdrug program has supported domestic law enforcement counterdrug activities for more than 30 years. In our review of the program, we found: DOD's strategy is out of date and doesn't reflect current drug threats. In 2014, the National Guard rescinded its guidance for states on how to operate and administer the program—and hasn't replaced it yet. DOD has funded state counterdrug activities...
title: Drug Control: DOD Should Improve Its Oversight of the National Guard Counterdrug Program
